law.catch_line: Sheriff's general obligation bonds and state revenue bond, state to pay premiums on.
law.text: With the exception of the sheriff's county levy bond, and with the exception of those bonds upon which the premium is now paid by the state or county, each sheriff shall have a valid claim against the state for the amounts paid by him for premiums on the bonds required of him by law, when the bonds have been executed by an incorporated surety company authorized to do a surety business in Kentucky, and when the claims are verified by the sheriff's affidavit. This section is intended to supersede subsection (1) of KRS 62.140 with respect to sheriffs whose fees are paid into the State Treasury.
law.history: Amended 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 126, sec. 1, effective June 19, 1958. -- Amended 1948 Ky. Acts ch. 111, sec. 1. -- Created 1946 Ky. Acts ch. 171, sec. 1.
